pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:5.1: 37. The training rule on within their own country
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:6.2: At that time the nuns went wandering without a group of travelers where it was considered dangerous and frightening within their own country.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:7.3: “How can nuns go wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered dangerous and frightening within their own country?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:7.7: How can nuns go wandering without a group of travelers where it was considered dangerous and frightening within their own country?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:8.1: ‘If a nun goes wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered dangerous and frightening within her own country, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:10.2: in the country where she is living.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:14.3: If it is in an uninhabited area, in the wilderness, then for every six kilometers she commits an offense entailing confession.
